item.label: Allows the Vivado router to explore different critical path routes after an initial route.
Prevents the router from relaxing timing to complete routing.
Uses detailed timing analysis throughout all stages instead of just the final stages.
Adjusts the router's internal cost functions to emphasize delay over iterations.
Uses more accurate skew modeling throughout all routing stages.
Run fewest iterations, trade higher design performance for faster run time
Fastest runtime, non-timing-driven, performs the minimum required placement for the design.

parameter.label: Skip pre-route
parameter.tooltip: Do not run pre route TCL commands

parameter.label: Skip snapshot save
parameter.tooltip: Do not create snapshot after route

parameter.label: Parse warnings
parameter.tooltip: Parse warning messages

parameter.label: Parse info
parameter.tooltip: Parse info messages

parameter.label: Grep filter
parameter.tooltip: Calculated grep filter

parameter.label: Pre-route TCL commands
parameter.tooltip: TCL commands to run before route_design

parameter.label: Directive
parameter.tooltip: Direct routing to achieve specific design objectives

parameter.label: Unroute
parameter.tooltip: Unroute all nets (specific nets unroute not supported.

parameter.label: Re-entrant mode
parameter.tooltip: When on - preserve routing data after finishing routing to speed-up next passes.

parameter.label: Physical nets only
parameter.tooltip: Route/unroute only logical '1'/logical '0' nets. Note: The -re_entrant, -nets, -physical_nets, and -pin options are mutually exclusive.

parameter.label: Nets to priocess
parameter.tooltip: Route/unroute only the specified nets. Note: The -re_entrant, -nets, -physical_nets, and -pin options are mutually exclusive.

parameter.label: To pin only
parameter.tooltip: Route/unroute only the specified pin. Note: The -re_entrant, -nets, -physical_nets, and -pin options are mutually exclusive.

parameter.label: Use timing constraints
parameter.tooltip: Use timing constraints when -nets or -pin options are selected (otherwise they are ignored)

parameter.label: Max delay to pin (ps)
parameter.tooltip: With -pin only. Target maximal delay to the specified pin (-delay option is implied).

parameter.label: Min delay to pin (ps)
parameter.tooltip: With -pin only. Target minimal delay to the specified pin (-delay option is implied).

parameter.label: No timing-driven
parameter.tooltip: Disables the default timing driven routing algorithm.

parameter.label: Preserve routing
parameter.tooltip: Preserve routing for the current routing session (no rip-up and reroute phase)

parameter.label: Do not overlap
parameter.tooltip: Do not overlap routing resources at early stages of routing (before final resolution).

parameter.label: Quiet
parameter.tooltip: Ignore errors, return TCL_OK in any case

parameter.label: Verbose
parameter.tooltip: Temporarily override message limits set with set_msg_config

parameter.label: Errors
parameter.tooltip: Regular expression for error messages

parameter.label: Warnings
parameter.tooltip: Regular expression for warnings messages

parameter.label: Info

"cd ~/%VivadoProjectRoot
" "set outputDir ~/%VivadoProjectRoot/%VivadoRemoteDir
" "file mkdir $outputDir
"
"%PreRouteTCL
"
"puts "No pre-route TCL commands specified"
"'
"route_design" "%directive_route" "%unroute" "%re_entrant" "%physical_nets" "%nets" "%pin" "%delay" "%max_delay" "%min_delay" "%no_timing_driven_routing" "%preserve" "%free_resource_mode" "%quiet_route" "%verbose_route" "
" "puts "@@FINISH@@"
"
